intro: Patrinia dielsii var. palustris, commonly known as swamp patrinia, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in East Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically white or pale purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds.
